name: Siebel eScript: Avoid Functions with more than X variables
description:
This rule reports Functions with more than X variable.
X is a parameter, named "Siebel: Max Variables", and it can be changed at will.
Default value is 15.
output:
This rule reports Functions with too many variables. It displays:
- Function full name
- The associated value is the Number of variables
rationale:
Declare your variables. Declaring your variables and specifying their data type, as appropriate, can use less memory and improve performance.
For maintainability and readability reasons, Function should not have too many variables.
remediation: Review the Function design to reduce the number of variables.
total: Number of added or modified eScripts
alternativeName: Siebel eScript: Avoid Functions with more than X variables
